name: Birling Gap from the Tiger Inn, South Downs East

ai.summary: A 10.3 km coastal hike from the Tiger Inn to Birling Gap along the South Downs East. Expect sea views, chalk cliffs, and a mix of grassy paths with some exposed cliff-top sections, typically at a moderate pace (roughly 3–4 hours).
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined paths on chalk and flint, with grassy trods and some steep descents/ascents near the coastline. Expect uneven surfaces and potential slipperiness after rain; stay on official paths and be mindful near cliff edges.
ai.safety_notes: Stay away from unstable cliff edges and keep to marked trails. Weather along the coast can change quickly, so carry layers and a waterproof. Wear sturdy footwear, bring water, and check tide times if you plan to explore near Birling Gap. Inform someone of your route and avoid solo travel in poor conditions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or GPS device and charged phone
Lightweight emergency rain cover or blanket

seo.title: Birling Gap from the Tiger Inn – South Downs East Coastal Hike (10.3 km)
seo.meta_description: Discover the 10.3 km coastal hike from the Tiger Inn to Birling Gap along the South Downs East. A moderate route with stunning sea views, chalk cliffs, and coastal paths.
seo.h1: Birling Gap from the Tiger Inn, South Downs East (10.3 km)
